snippet: The vote this week over Britain’s membership in the European Union has prompted deep, sometimes bitter divisions, even between mothers and children.
abstract: Many families in Britain are divided over upcoming referendum on whether United Kingdom should remain part of European Union, and in some cases, like that of the Driscoll family in London, the debate has become heated and even destructive; referendum appears to be splitting British population along socioeconomic and regional lines, with many older and working-class voters in England favoring departure from EU.
lead_paragraph: The vote this week over Britain’s membership in the European Union has prompted deep, sometimes bitter divisions, even between mothers and children.

headline.main: Stay or Go? E.U. Referendum Divides British Families
headline.print_headline: Stay or Go? E.U. Referendum Divides British Families
